snippet: In contrast to past friction over settlements or the peace process, the focus was on threats from Iran and Syria.
abstract: Vice President Joseph R Biden Jr and Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu, in back-to-back speeches at annual conference of American Israel Public Affairs Committee, seek to smooth over any friction between United States and Israel, three weeks before Pres Obama makes his first trip as president to Jerusalem; elaborate display of harmony is departure from recent years, when conference often showcased tensions over the peace process or settlement activity.
lead_paragraph: In contrast to past friction over settlements or the peace process, the focus was on threats from Iran and Syria.

headline.main: Biden and Netanyahu Stress Points of Unity in Speeches to Pro-Israel Group
headline.print_headline: Biden and Netanyahu Stress Points of Unity in Speeches to Pro-Israel Group
